about_the_game:
『NOAH: 2050』 presents you with one question:

“What decision will you make in the face of the death you caused?”

You’ll find the answer through your gameplay.

『NOAH: 2050』 incorporates environmental issues, which can otherwise seem daunting, into its backdrop. It’s structured in a way that allows you to explore environmental problems from various perspectives, beyond just extreme weather phenomena.

Enjoy 『NOAH: 2050』, set in the near future of 2050, where you’ll experience various events and psychological shifts in characters.

World Setting: Between Reality and Unreality

In the near future of 2050, we have failed to reduce carbon emissions.

Frequent extreme weather events and disasters caused by severe environmental pollution have become unstoppable for any nation.

As sea levels rise and desertification spreads, inhabitable areas continue to increase.

At that time, a leading developed country, ranked third in the global economy, was submerged underwater, shocking many people.

In a belated response, the world began to focus on environmental issues.

In 2032, Environmental Organization (EO), an independent global agency with the power to enforce measures on environmental issues, was established.

EO oversees regulations on environmental pollution, nature restoration projects, and the improvement of living conditions for environmental refugees.

However, despite EO’s efforts, environmental restoration projects have been slow, and the situation worsened as the number of environmental refugees rapidly increased. EO found itself focused solely on resolving the housing issues of these refugees.

But it’s not just homes that are threatened.

As the ecosystem's cycle breaks down, growing crops has become increasingly difficult, leading to a severe food crisis.

Foreseeing this, HR Company introduced SOL-A Capsules, a food substitute that provides a full day’s meal in a single capsule.

In 2038, when growing conventional crops became difficult and food prices skyrocketed, the SOL-A Capsules emerged to resolve the food crisis.

However, the timely introduction of the capsules stirred up various controversies.

As the stable world began to falter, the CEO of Won-Kang Construction, eager to control the situation, decided to build his own tower, the Ark.

The tower's construction plan was established, funded by investments from several wealthy individuals.

Although the plan faced opposition during the approval process due to concerns about environmental and view obstructions, the promise to house some environmental refugees secured the construction permit.

Though you live an ordinary life, there’s nothing ordinary about the events that await you in these extraordinary times.

Meals: Don’t forget to eat once a day.

Players must consume food each day. If you remain hungry for too long, you may die.

Use the school vending machines to buy food items and use them from your inventory.

Certain food items grant special effects.

Exploration: Introducing Mulcho High School

Explore various parts of the school using the exploration system.

Learn about daily life at Mulcho High, and uncover special objects hidden throughout the school to discover new scenarios.

Messenger & News: New stories are posted every day.

Exchange messages in various chat rooms to increase affinity with characters or gather new information.

The news keeps you updated on the current events happening in Mulcho City.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 SP1, Windows 10 and Windows 11
  • Processor: x86, x64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support.
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX10, DX11, DX12 capable.
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Hardware vendor officially supported drivers. For development: IL2CPP scripting backend requires Visual Studio 2015 with C++ Tools component or later and Windows 10+ SDK.

short_description: 『NOAH: 2050』 is a 2D visual novel game that blends an adventure format where you can explore a school.
